reviews.review:
One of the worst political games I have played. The racial statements aren't sewn up in the end and seem like they are there more for a shock value.  (spoiler alert)* The ending makes no sense in terms of why he would end his life if there are infinite possibilities? So there is no way in all those "stars" that he can't make something better? He came from wounded knee and knows sacrifices but he gets rid of all that for a future he doesn't know is better or worse? His intention rips him away from his daughter to what? It doesn't make sense with his character. 
Now for the technical aspects most of the in game "vendors" take you out of the game because they just don't make sense. As well everyone just disappearing in the whole city? Where are the homes and parks or the rest of the "utopia" you never get to see? I just don't believe every white person is like "Fuck it we're out of here".  They were able to hide all of this by the female lead in your face all the time but the story really wasn't fleshed out and I am pretty sure a seasoned veteran and private eye would make most of the decisions the main character made. So in conclusion it's an okay ride but not even close to a good story that makes any real sense. Especially when you add a ghost.

"Booker Catch........."
Would recommend!
Игруха cool!!!!!!!!!!

9/10 Would play again. (And I'm currently replaying the game right now.)

This game is not only stunningly beautiful but it's also well made and more than anything, a kind of standalone game compared to the first two Bioshocks. (Even thought playing or at least knowing some of the plot could be interesting in understanding the game.) You shouldn't expect something that will emotionally move you because you won't get that here. It's a full on FPS with a more than decent plotline to get you going. I must admit it gets quite confusing after a while and you might need to keep up with it. I highly recommend you take time to pick up the audio logs and everything because they help a lot in understanding why what's happening it happening.

Tl;dr : Good game, Good gameplay, Awesome graphics, Really good storyline.

Pick it up during a sale if you're not that much into games like this but I do believe it's a classic that needs to be played.

Eine eindeutige Kaufempfehlung
Overwhelming plot, gameplay, graphics and sound design make this game an outstanding and memorable experience.

Is short and lacks lasting appeal past MAYBE a second playthrough...  But the gameplay is fun, the graphics are pretty, and the story is jaw-dropping once you wrap your head around the ending.  Worth buying on sale, considering the lack of content.

Edit: Watched some YouTube videos made by people smarter than me, played some more story-based games, and revisited this game.  Thought my initial enjoyment of the game hasn't diminished at all, I gotta say the story really isn't all I talked it up to be.  Still fun to shoot people.  Low-key racist.

Игра пройдена. После финальных титров осталось чувство разочарования. Ожидал больше.
В сущности перед нами тот же BioShock что и несколько лет назад. Оружия чувствуется так же, плазмиды немного изменены, но на картину в целом не сильно влияет. Подача сюжета осталась та же, т.е. в какой то момент игры заходим на территорию где появляется оппонент, который несёт чушь до свое гибели. Комнаты с волнами идущими врагов. Кто играл в первые две части ничего нового не увидят. И в целом такое бросание из одной сюжетной канавы в другую на любителя, мне не понравилось. 
 
Что же заставляет проходить эту игру? Сюжет и сеттинг. Они впечатляют. Первые время просто ходишь и всё рассматриваешь. Не потому что какая то супер графика, она как раз то довольно средняя, а потому что интересно. Такого больше нигде не было и не факт что будет. Воздушный город, враги, разговоры на улице - всё ново и интересно. Сюжет так же не даёт заскучать развиваясь постепенно и не оставляя игрока на долгое время, играть реально интересно. 

 К концу игры интерес ослабевает, к воздушному городу привыкаешь и приходит осознания что это просто декорации, игра всё равно проходит в помещениях. Перестрелки не очень интересны, типов врагов мало и т.д. Не то что бы это критично, но уже начинаешь ждать финала. На концовку я возлагал большие надежды, но вот здесь ждало главное разочарование. Создав такой необычный мир, необычных персонажей, соловья и скатится к такой банальщине (не буду спойлерить)...  Придумай разработчики что то более оригинально и запоминающееся, впечатления после прохождения игры были бы совсем другие.  

Игру конечно же стоит пройти, своих денег она стоит (брал со скидкой). Много моментов которые запомнятся. Но это не идеал, как может показаться после многих отзывов и обзоров. Второй раз проходить я бы её не стал.

This is a great game, I would recommend it to anyone who enjoys games with a story and some mystery. The game play itself was solid and the range of weapons and abilities gave it a lot of variety. I do wish it was a little longer, I played it through in about 11 hours. Both of the DLC episodes were good but each only added about 5 hrs of game play.

[i]Bioshock Infinite is a competent first person shooter that really excels in environment design and tells an intriguing and well-crafted story. It's one of my favorite games of last year. [/i]

The Bioshock games have been pretty well known across the entire gaming sphere, and doing a retro review now seems kind of redundant, because you've already likely bought the game, loved it, married it, and had a wonderful honeymoon, or you were incredibly dissappointed, left in the middle of the night and never gave it a call again, you [b]monster.[/b]

But for those of you who haven't bought it yet, you're missing out on one of the most interesting experiences of last year. Love it or hate it, it's definitely one of the more interesting games to talk about. The story is interesting, the environments are well designed. Whereas Rapture had you feeling alone and isolated against forces beyond your control, Infinite by contrast is now a swashbuckling adventure akin to the likes of Uncharted, where you play as Scruffy Mc Grufferson the Generic Handsome White Guy Seeking Redemption For His Dark And Tortured Past™ (I'm looking on getting the name shortened), aka Booker DeWitt, a man with neither books nor wits, to rescue a girl named Elizabeth from the Cloud City of Columbia.

From there, things rapidly deteriorate when Booker is discovered to be the person prophesized by the Prophet to ruin everything, so the citizens of Columbia make it their sole duty to ruin everything first so that Booker doesn't get a chance.

The gameplay is competant, but unremarkable; Booker gets a standard suite of Steampunk weaponry, pistols, machine guns, shotguns, oh my, along with a suite of Vigors™, which are different from Plasmids™ in the sole way of that you drink them instead of injecting them. (Actually, the powers are more varied than Bioshock's; one of my favorite new additions was the one that let you shoot crows to viciously peck at enemies while I whack them with my ice cream scoop.)

One of the cooler gameplay features that help liven up the shooting aspects are the addition of rails that let you take to the skies and travel from place to place. Not only does this open up a new dimension in combat, but also makes exploration a joy as opposed to a chore.

The story is a little pretentious, but overall I liked it and thought it was quite interesting, even when it becomes a nigh-incomprehensible mess when alternate realities get introduced. It helps that Booker and Elizabeth are both strong characters, even though they're not terribly unique archetypes, they're still assembled with care and I do feel a sting of emotional attachment when tragedy befalls them.

[b]To be honest, I have no idea whether you would like Bioshock Infinite or not. There doesn't seem to be any rhyme or reason or common criticisms, but I do recommend it, and feel it's at least worth your time. It's well-crafted and beautifully designed.[/b]

Я прошёл третий Биошок. Мне очень понравилось. Прошёл на одном дыхании и практически в один пресест (за 8 часов с перерывом на сон). Да, все зачем-то нахваливали рандомные коммонновые фичи игры: элизабет, концовку, атмосферу, рендер... всё это тут очень качественное и правильное, но такое же как во многих других играх. Идентичное, я бы даже сказал. Но настаящая причина для похвалы в этой игре совсем другая и я формулирую её так: "просто BioShock Infinite - оxyeнный!" И у этой "медали" нет обратной стороны.

Fantastic game with great gameplay (the added vertical combat and movement is amazing and a lot of fun to experiment with, and damn that skyhook is an awesome weapon), amazing visuals and a compelling story with fasinating characters and one hell of an ending. Elizabeth herself is a fantastic companion who feels like a living, breathing human being who acts and reacts realistically. Her AI is brilliant as she never once got in my way; on the contrary she's extremely helpful as she often throws you healing packs when you need them the most as well as ammo and money that she scrounges up while the two of you explore the environment. Her tears themselves can be life-savers and game-changers, especialy during the tougher sections of the campaign.
You need to have played Bioshock 1 to fully understand a number of the references and story tie-ins, especially in the DLCs (which you should get and play immediately after beating this game, they're that good). Also, one thing that I've always wanted to see were regular people going about their day-to-day business in the worlds of Rapture and you finally get to see that here in the seemingly utopic floating world of Columbia that harbours ugly thruths and realities. It makes the game feel that more immersive and is an absolute delight to behold as the NPCs talk, dance, exercise and more, beautifully animated and renderred the whole while. The same can be said of Burial At Sea Episode 1 as it occurs before the 'fall' of Rapture and you see its citizens going about their business in lush settings.
Finally, if you hadn't already gotten the message (:P) I strongly suggest getting the Burial At Sea DLCs as they continue Elizabeth's story and will have you exclaiming in awe at the sheer scope and impact of the story that Irrational has lovingly created for us.

10/10

[h1]Bioshock Infinite[/h1] - Это игра, в Которую хочеться играть из-за сюжета и Красивой графики! :D Наш Главный Герой Букер Дэвитт Который должен заплатить долг свой одной Барышней- [u]Элизабет[/u] .Он поподает туда на небеса типа "Рая"! ну и после чего через пару сотен локаций мы таки находим её(хорошо что хоть книжкой не ёбнула xD). Далее на придёться добираться до дережабля.потомдо другого дережабля и вообщем всё ! xъ Но Элизабет не простая бабенция,она может перемещать нас через разрывы в разные места(Портал бл8ть! xD) . Она Хороший компаньон оружия аптечку соли кинет нам всегда! :D Так же есть дополнение Морская могила![spoiler] (второй эпизод напрочь на работает! D:< )[/spoiler] В первом эпизоде мы ищем девочку Салли а второй Я ЖЕ СКАЗАЛ ЧТО НЕ РАботает почему то! Оценка игры 8.4/10 если бы работал второй эпизод то была бы выше! спс за прочтение!

I was one of those people who never really liked the first Bioshock.  Its kinda steampunk underwater turn-of-the-century feel didn't really appeal to me and I eventually traded in the game.  However, this game - Bioshock Infinite - was one that I DID like.  A decent story (even if it got a bit weird at the end), and the gloom and murkiness of the predecessors was replaced by light and a generally happier feel.  Having completed the game, I'm tempted to play it again and try different weapons and tactics.  However, first I thought I'd give the DLC a try...

BIG mistake.

Burial At Sea Episodes One and Two may as well be add-ons for the original Bioshock games, which is NOT what I expect from DLC.  I expect a twist or extra levels to the game that you've just played.  (Which, to be fair is what you get with Clash In The Clouds, even if it's not all THAT great.)  However, Burial At Sea takes you back to very different world to that you experienced in Infinite - the world of Bioshock 1 and 2.  Add to that the meandering, constantly twisting storylines and (in Ep 2), the inability to melee kill an enemy unless they are unaware of you (?!?), the add-on content just sucks.  Burial At Sea is named after what should have been done with both those DLC Episodes - they should've been weighed down with lead and dropped into the Mariana Trench.

Added to that, the basic game plus the DLC takes up 44 GIGABYTES of HD space.  FORTY FOUR GIGS!!!  Yeah the game looks beautiful, but bloody hell, it's a hard-drive hogger.

So in summary, buy Bioshock Infinite - great game.  I really enjoyed it.   But if you're considering buying the DLC, avoid Burial AT Sea and just stick with Clash In The Clouds.
Great game!

Best game I ever played, and I played most of them, if not all.

I started playing, and I didn't stop until the final scene. It took me 13 hours, and I took it SLOWLY but what an insane game.

The scenery and atmosphere is straight out of a psychedelic trip, i can't even describe it. 

The story is so deep it will leave you thinking for weeks, and the research the developers must have put into this is just breathtaking.

The music is spot on, and i often found myself just abusing the ingame radios to replay songs. Voice acting flawless aswell.

Even the characters are so well crafted, to the point where you can feel their personalities, very rare imho.

Usually when I play FPS games, its for the combat the action and so on. But in this game, the combat actually anoyyed me, cus it meant that i didn't get any lore, that i didn't get to explore and feel the game.

Throughout my entire playthrough i didn't encounter a single bug, i didn't have to restart the game once and not even a visual bug was to be found.

And if you think you're a hardcore player, you can just play on hard, and i promise you it will be a challenge even for the top skilled.

If I have to compare this to other games, i would say Half-life 1 with a stronger story, and much more atmosphere minus the puzzles. 

This is a standalone game, the story really doesn't overlap with bioshock 1/2, and you can easily play this without playing the others. Definetely the best in the series.

Best game I played nuff said.

An amazing work of story writing, voice acting and a generation masterpiece in the field of video gaming. It is a real blast with a conclusion that will make you want to play it all over again, to piece the story together. I recommend that you also buy the Buiral at sea DLC for it as well, as it is a great conclustion to the bioshock series in a beauiful knot.

My favorite from the series the change in scenery is remarkably pleasant, with the story being quite complex and original, it's a solid game which also suffers from the previous two games in terms of gunplay which luckly the story and exploration make up for it.

Самая лучшая часть Bioshock.Шутеры с таким глубоким сюжетом редко встречаются.Здесь же сюжет просто мозг взрывает!Игровые пейзажи завораживают, геймплей в лучших традициях Bioshock с множеством новых возможностей.Один из немногих шутеров,который хочется пройти снова.Для любителей не просто пострелять,но и понять зачем это нужно и узнать что же там будет дальше.Затягивает до самого конца,а после прохождения оставляет кучу впечатлений и вопросов.
В общем,если вы фанат серии Bioshock, то игра просто must have.Это особенный мир,атмосфера и события которого поглотят вас,пережуют и выплюнут в скучную реальность с большим спектром чувств и эмоций.

2deep4u

Ken Levine and the staff of Bioshock Infinite are geniuses. I promise you the storyline of this game is one of the best. If you don't own this game you are missing out on playing one of the all time greatest games ever developed.  The graphics are fantastic. The music is amazing. You get connected to lead characters early in the game and there are no slow sections or parts that are left open or confusing. When I played this game I thought it was going to be short. I kept thinking the end was near but the plot kept opening more doors and kept becoming more complex. Interactive media does not get better than this. This is a new standard for gaming. Yes there are a couple of small issues with the difficulty balance I played on hard and felt that should have been medium but I also felt this was a game that people who didnt like fps games could jump right in and enjoy so maybe thats a pro more than a con. I encontered 2 bugs the entire game one of which was a targeting issue (crow commanding) the other was a boss section (boss caught behind unopenable door) and thats it! I hope other developers can start creating games this polished because lately it seems like every AAA title is broken on delivery and its insulting. Bravo to the staff you nailed this one. I also believe there is some replayability on this title but maybe after a 6 month break when you've kind of forgotten the story a little bit similar to halflife2 ( I always go back to it). There are plenty of ways to defend and there are different paths you can take with your perks and weapons preferences. This game took me 16 hours to complete. **One last note I was getting motion sickness from "Bioshock 2" and could not complete it "Bioshock Infinite" did not effect me at all and I played for 4-8 hour intervals** 10/10

3º Parte de la grán saga Bioshock. Nos encontramos con Booker de Witt que ha perdido todo su mujer a muerto y tuvo que dar a su hija para saldar sus deudas hasta que se le aparecen los hermanos Lutter que le piden que consigan a una chica que se llama Elisabeth par apoder saldar todas las deudas que tiene por todos los años que a pasado en el "Mundo" del alcohol. Al acabar esta grán obra maestra no puedes casi ni hablar porque tienes tantas cosas en tu cabeza que cuesta porque alfinal responden muchas de las dudas que has podido llegar a tener durante el juego, aparte te das cuenta de muchas cosas como por ejemplo lo de los trailers si te das cuenta ninguno es igual y es porque cada uno se basa en una dimensión diferente. Mi juego favorito me quede asombrado alfinal. (También tengo que decir que hay momentos en los que le meten muchisimo relleno al juego como por ejemplo que quieres pasar por un lado y derrepente se cae el puente sin ninguna razón pero por lo de mas es una OBRA MAESTRA)

Man, is this an epic game! Great science-fantasy story, sexy yet sympathetic main characters, eye-dropping graphics and world-building, and almost-nauseatingly exhilarating fast zipline movement and combat. The eerie Stepford peace and perfection of the city of Columbia is shown well. The city and characters' origins, and the great conflict that eventually arises, feels moving and real. The use of powers and weapons in combat was done really well, and the foes and antagonists are far more compelling here than in the original BioShock games.

The story gets a bit janky and heavy-handed at the very end. There are some plot holes and notably abrupt changes for certain characters. One massive boss fight that everyone expected seems oddly absent (DLC one day?). But ultimately a great game, which will stick with you for a while.

overall, get this game.................

Nem is tudom, hogy hogyan kezdjek bele, ennek a csodálatos,gyönyörű,drámai,epic játék "értékelés" megírásába...
Ugye... Bioshock-ról van szó, tehát csalódni nem fogunk, ahogy az elöző részekben sem kellett (kicsit nálam a második rész annyira nem jött be, mint az elődje és ez :D)

A széria első két része víz alatti városba Rapture-be kalauzolt el minket, na már most Columbia ennek pont az ellentétje ugyanis ez a város a felhök fölött helyezkedik el.


Nem fogunk sokszor meghalni, én az egész játékban max 2-szer voltam a földön (Normál)
[b]DE,  sikerült végigjátszanom 1999 mode-ban is, egy kicsit sűrűbben történt az átfutok az ellenségeken mert nincs lőszerem illetve a halálozási ráta is emelkedett :D[/b]
Elizabeth nem hátráltat minket, mint sok más játékban itt nincsen az, hogy "segítő" társunkra kell várni, vagy hogy kezdhetjük előrről az egészet mert befutott az ellenségek közé bújócskázni...

Elizabeth harc közben fedezékbe bújik, tárgyakat keres, és amint talál valamit, ami alkalmas lenne számunkra, jelzi is. (pl: kevés a HP-nk erre ő szól, hogy találtam potion-t, vagy, hogy amikor kezdesz kifogyni a lőszerből akkor talál lőszert) sokszor élet mentő lehet egy-egy ütközetben


Ennyi elég is, de tényleg mert nem nagyon lehet róla beszélni, spoiler nélkül mert annyira lenyűgöző :D

Bioshock evreni hep ütopyalarda geçiyor ve ütopyaların yanında yüksek kaosları da getirdiğini bize çok iyi bir şekilde aktarmayı başarıyor.

Bioshock Infinite her oyuncunun arşivinde bulunması gereken ve bitirilmesi gereken bir oyun. Atmosferi, müzikleri, seslendirmeleri, çarpıcı karakterleri ve güzel replikleri ile dikkat çeken bir oyun. Ne zamandır arşivimde bulunmasına rağmen bu kadar geç başlamamın sebebi sadece birinci oyundu. Çünkü Rapture'ı o kadar sevdim ki Columbia'yı sevmemekten korktum açıkçası. Fakat Columbia beni fazlasıyla etkilemeyi başardı. Söylemem gereken bir şey var o da Infinite'in ilk oyundan daha iyi olmadığı. Çünkü ilk oyun o kadar sağlam ki sanırım başka hiç bir Bioshock oyununu ilki kadar sevemeyeceğim. Oyunun incelemesine geçecek olursam oyunun tamamının sağlam bir senaryo etrafına inşa edildiğini görüyoruz. Eğer Infinite bu kadar sağlam senaryoyla gelmesedi muhtemelen oyunda gördüğümüz hiç bir şeyin bir anlamı kalmayacaktı. Elizabeth o kadar güzel çizilmiş ki masmavi gözleriyle bakarken gülümsetmeyi başardı. İlk oyuna yapılan göndermeler de gayet güzeldi. Oyunun artılarına ve eksilerine geçelim :

+ Unreal Engine ile yapılmış olması ki bence üstüne bir grafik motoru yok.
+ Muhteşem Columbia tasarımı ve bunun mantıklı bir çerçeveye oturtulması
+ Seslendirmeler ve karakter modellemeleri
+ Müzikler ve diyaloglar
+ Oynanıştan bir şey kaybetmeden daha da ileriye götürmesi

- İlk oyunda işimize yarayan haritanın bu oyunda olmaması
- Ses kayıtları dinlerken altyazı olmaması (menüden girip okuyabiliyoruz)
- Hikaye anlatımında karmaşanın fazla olması ve karakterlerin birden dahil olması

Bu yazdığım eksikler sinir bozucu veya oyundan alınan keyfi azaltan şeyler değil. Sadece keşke şu da olsaymış denilecek ufak detaylar. Elizabeth ve Booker DeWitt'in macerasını mutlaka görmelisiniz.

When I played the first Bioshock games I felt it was somewhat the same game just differnt views, this game has the same core as a Bioshock game but its not underwater (doh) so the playinstyle aside and the vigors this is a totaly differnt game. 

 *spoiler* The choises you make dont really matter unlike the other games, but then thats kind of the core of this game, it has a deep story thats good but with a few flaws, but still very fun and entertaning a bit confusing. But if you like shooting games and a good story this has both, the game is a bit linar and not very open world.. but still a fun game if you like a good story :)
Круто,сюжет великолепен,дизайн графики бесподобен,каждый перснаж озвучен идеально,музыка идеальна,одним словом10/10

Hold to the old words of wisdom “Buyer beware” 
  
A master peace of “marketing hype”, selling you a poorly designed rushed shooter, dressed up with eye candy and developed with a deliberately “controversial” (controversial adjective : giving rise or likely to give rise to public disagreement)  story line to attract maximum media coverage.  I fell for it and paid the price not just the purchase price of the game but the price of my loss of faith in gaming as the last bastion of product makers who did not just want a fast fat profit.

In this game you shoot people until they die, and are generally confused about why most things are happening. Perhaps its because I spent so much time staring at the scenery that I forgot to pay attention to the actual plot.
BIOSHOCK Infinite has got to be one of the greatest games I have ever played, it is simply unforgetable! To be frank, all of the entries in the series are unforgetable experiences.

Enjoyed every minute. It's tough to follow in the footsteps of an iconic game and Bioshock Infinite exceeded all my expectations. Art direction was spot on (just like Bioshock 1), gameplay was fluid, and the story was great. I loved the absract concept of realities investigated throughout the game. Both "Burial at Sea" episodes are also a must if you have enjoyed the Bioshock series.

Beautiful game, beautiful ending.

I played this game straight after Bioshock and I much preferred this one. Gameplay is very fluent, the world is detailed and imaginative and the story starts off interesting but it ends with one of the most impressive endings I've ever seen yet. It is a lot different in many regards. Simply put, where Bioshock was a survival-horror-ish game, this is a regular action game but it does that very well. 

I would completely reccomend this, but it is best if you play the original first. Bioshock 2 is not needed in my regard.

This is my favorite game of all time. The ending is mindblowing, the characters are relatable and well fleshed out. The begining is not as powefule as the first game but the story is better. The combat is fun but sometimes it can detract from the story because often you want to know what happens next. This can also be good since it leaves a soon answered cliff hanger. This game is on har game to put down and is amazing
